page.title: 18PARISH CHURCH & LOCK-UP
page.content:
cricket pavillion. Twenty years ago Lodge farm was a model farm, the farmer now lives in Stokeham.
{TUXFORD PARISH CHURCH by Vicky Holmes
Saint Nicholas church is the oldest building in Tuxford. Some parts of it may have been built between ll62 - ll74, but the building we know didn't take shape until the thirteenth, fourteenth and fifteenth century, in l357 the church was given to Newstead Priory but the Priory was ruined by King Henry VIII and the curch was then given to Trinity College, Cambridge. The patronage of the church nowadays belongs to the Bishop of Southwell.
{THE LOCK UP by Nicola Moody In Nottinghamshire there are only two lock ups. Tuxford jail was built in
